definition: hiding place/hideout
Tibet/Xizang 西藏
storehouse/depository/Buddhist or Taoist scripture
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: This must be the place where the mysterious man was hiding!
sentences.chinese: 這一定就是那位神祕人士的藏身之處了。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner beat about for some place to hide.
sentences.chinese: 逃犯倉惶尋找個藏身之處。

sentences.english: We never should have given [the insurgents] sanctuary to start with.
sentences.chinese: 我們本來就不應該給暴亂分子任何藏身之處。

sentences.english: Some suspect the ISI may even know where Osama bin Laden is hiding.
sentences.chinese: 一些人懷疑ISI甚至可能知曉本拉登的藏身之處。

sentences.english: They can return to the warehouse hideout.
sentences.chinese: 他們又回到了藏身之處。

sentences.english: Chen big kill sunspot father, straight to the face of people hiding place.
sentences.chinese: 陳大殺死黑子父親，直向疤臉人藏身之處走來。

sentences.english: We're taken deep into their hideout in Iraq's Cargill Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我們被帶到他們在伊拉克卡吉爾山的藏身之處。

sentences.english: The mountains were once the hiding place for locals escaping the endless stream of foreign invaders.
sentences.chinese: 這些山曾是當地人躲避一批批外國入侵者的藏身之處。

sentences.english: Jan. 29, 2009 -- How do you make a fish come out of hiding?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能使一條魚從它的的藏身之處出來呢？

sentences.english: He was only just arrived from hiding place stand out, immediately be Japanese shot and killed.
sentences.chinese: 不料他剛從藏身之處站出來，立即被日本人開槍殺死。

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to whisper to one another's ear
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to obstruct/to impede
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
the critical moment/life and death crisis
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
a memo book (recording events)
